update.description:
Add a system which publishes `ignition::msgs::Scene` messages populated with entities and components. These messages will be consumed by an ign-gui plugin which will populate a rendering scene.

This is part of a temporary alternative to pull request #39. The next PR will add the GUI plugin.

---

## UPDATED

Try it out

1. Load a world:

    `ign-gazebo -v 3 -f ../test/worlds/multiple_worlds.sdf -s`

2. Check the published topics

    `ign topic -l`

        /world/world_one/pose/info
        /world/world_one/stats
        /world/world_three/pose/info
        /world/world_three/stats
        /world/world_two/stats

3. Check the advertised services:

        /world/world_one/control
        /world/world_one/scene/graph
        /world/world_one/scene/info
        /world/world_three/control
        /world/world_three/scene/graph
        /world/world_three/scene/info
        /world/world_two/control

3. Echo pose messages

    `ign topic -e -t /world/world_three/pose/info`

4. Due to [this ign-transport issue](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/issues/97/call-one-way-requester-responder-from), we can't use the `ign service` command line to test the scene services. So an example program was added:

    1. Build the example

            cd examples/standalone/scene_requester
            mkdir build
            cd build
            cmake ..
            make -j8

    1. Request scene info:

            ./scene_requester /world/world_one/scene/info info

    1. Request scene graph:

            ./scene_requester /world/world_one/scene/graph graph

        > Tip: paste the graph output here: http://www.webgraphviz.com/
update.title: New system: Scene broadcaster

content.html:
827215e Got it, followed the EntityComponentManager example, this is the winning syntax:

  /** \class SceneBroadcaster SceneBroadcaster.hh \
   * ignition/gazebo/systems/SceneBroadcaster.hh
  **/
  /// \brief System which periodically publishes an ignition::msgs::Scene
  /// message with updated information.

Note the \

content.html:
This didn't seem to do it. I tried

  /**\class SceneBroadcaster SceneBroadcaster.hh
  * ignition/gazebo/systems/SceneBroadcaster.hh
  **/
  /// \brief System which periodically publishes an ignition::msgs::Scene
  /// message with updated information.

and

  /**
   * \class SceneBroadcaster SceneBroadcaster.hh
   * ignition/gazebo/systems/SceneBroadcaster.hh
   */
  /// \brief System which periodically publishes an ignition::msgs::Scene
  /// message with updated information.

Do we have some working example?

content.raw: It looks like you fixed the memory leak.
content.html: It looks like you fixed the memory leak.

content.raw: I just used `top`, and let `ign-gazebo` run. `valgrind` probably would also work. I’ll test again.
content.html: I just used top, and let ign-gazebo run. valgrind probably would also work. I’ll test again.

content.raw: The “#include <SceneBroadcaster.hh>” line near the top should be “#include <ignition/gazebo/SceneBroadcaster.hh>”.
content.html: The “#include <SceneBroadcaster.hh>” line near the top should be “#include <ignition/gazebo/SceneBroadcaster.hh>”.

content.raw: Merged pull request #43 into this one.
content.html: Merged pull request #43 into this one.

content.raw: There is a memory leak someplace, not necessarily here.
content.html: There is a memory leak someplace, not necessarily here.

content.raw: Or is that handled by the `sceneGraph`?
Is this a memory leak? You new up a `msgs::Model`,but never delete it.
content.html: Is this a memory leak? You new up a msgs::Model,but never delete it.

content.raw:
Can you add a “\\todo” that captures the need of a function in EntityComponentManager that returns true if an entity exists with a specified set of component types? This would allow us to do 

‌

    if (ecm.Has<components::World, components::Name>)

A similar function that returns a count would be nice as well.
content.html:
Can you add a “\todo” that captures the need of a function in EntityComponentManager that returns true if an entity exists with a specified set of component types? This would allow us to do

‌

if (ecm.Has<components::World, components::Name>)

A similar function that returns a count would be nice as well.

`**/ `

Check out the doxygen rendered version of this. I think you have to do:

**/
